data.title: Novels/Novellas 2023 | But now I will tell the lineage and the names of the heroes, and of the long sea-paths and the deeds
data.text:
WARNING: NOT ABOUT GAMES

Here's an accounting of all of the novels/novellas I read in 2023.

25 Novels/Novellas - Alphabetical

Babel - R.F. Kuang

Carrie - Stephen King

The Caves of Steel - Isaac Asimov

The Crane Husband - Kelly Barnhill

The Door of No Return - Kwame Alexander

The Drowned World - J.G. Ballard

Elmer Kelton’s The Unlikely Lawman - Steve Kelton

Fire on the Mountain - Terry Bisson

Guards! Guards! - Terry Pratchett

The Dark Tower I: The Gunslinger - Stephen King

The Dark Tower II: The Drawing of the Three - Stephen King

The Dark Tower III: The Waste Lands - Stephen King

Hatchet - Gary Paulsen

The Hawkline Monster - Richard Brautigan

Interstellar Pig - William Sleator

The Knights of the Cornerstone - James Blaylock

Legends & Lattes - Travis Baldtree

A Lesson Before Dying - Ernest J. Gaines

Moby-Dick; or, The Whale - Herman Melville

The Navigating Fox - Christopher Rowe

Okla Hannali - R.A. Lafferty

Rage - Stephen King

'Salem’s Lot - Stephen King

What Moves the Dead - T. Kingfisher

The Whipping Boy - Sid Fleishmann

25 Novels/Novellas - Chronological

1851 Moby-Dick; or, The Whale - Herman Melville

1954 The Caves of Steel - Isaac Asimov

1962 The Drowned World - J.G. Ballard

1972 Okla Hannali - R.A. Lafferty

1974 Carrie - Stephen King

1974 The Hawkline Monster - Richard Brautigan

1975 'Salem’s Lot - Stephen King

1977 Rage - Stephen King

1982 The Dark Tower I: The Gunslinger - Stephen King

1984 Interstellar Pig - William Sleator

1986 Hatchet - Gary Paulsen

1986 The Whipping Boy - Sid Fleishmann

1987 The Dark Tower II: The Drawing of the Three - Stephen King

1988 Fire on the Mountain - Terry Bisson

1989 Guards! Guards! - Terry Pratchett

1991 The Dark Tower III: The Waste Lands - Stephen King

1993 A Lesson Before Dying - Ernest J. Gaines

2008 The Knights of the Cornerstone - James Blaylock

2021 The Door of No Return - Kwame Alexander

2022 Babel - R.F. Kuang

2022 Elmer Kelton’s The Unlikely Lawman - Steve Kelton

2022 Legends & Lattes - Travis Baldtree

2022 What Moves the Dead - T. Kingfisher

2023 The Crane Husband - Kelly Barnhill

2023 The Navigating Fox - Christopher Rowe

25 Novels/Novellas - Ranked

Masterpiece (it was amazing)

Moby-Dick; or, The Whale - Herman Melville

Very Good (really liked it)

The Dark Tower I: The Gunslinger - Stephen King

The Dark Tower II: The Drawing of the Three - Stephen King

The Dark Tower III: The Waste Lands - Stephen King

Okla Hannali - R.A. Lafferty

'Salem’s Lot - Stephen King

Good (liked it)

Babel - R.F. Kuang

Carrie - Stephen King

The Caves of Steel - Isaac Asimov

The Door of No Return - Kwame Alexander

The Drowned World - J.G. Ballard

Guards! Guards! - Terry Pratchett

Hatchet - Gary Paulsen

The Hawkline Monster - Richard Brautigan

Interstellar Pig - William Sleator

The Knights of the Cornerstone - James Blaylock

A Lesson Before Dying - Ernest J. Gaines

The Navigating Fox - Christopher Rowe

What Moves the Dead - T. Kingfisher

The Whipping Boy - Sid Fleishmann

I Finished It, Didn’t I? What More Do You Want From Me? (it was ok)

The Crane Husband - Kelly Barnhill

Elmer Kelton’s The Unlikely Lawman - Steve Kelton

Fire on the Mountain - Terry Bisson

Legends & Lattes - Travis Baldtree

Rage - Stephen King

DNF (did not like it)

99.999% of the YHPL New Fiction Shelf. There were some doozy first sentences though.

-----

I'm happy to talk/write about any of the above, especially if anyone has any strong opinions about any of them.

-----

In 2024, I'll soon finish two longer books (The Brothers Karamazov and Lonesome Dove) that I've been reading in 2023. It has been a great pleasure to run a book cub focused on Stephen King's Dark Tower, a crazy idea that I had that I got away with doing. That book club will continue in 2024 and so I'll finish The Dark Tower and probably read more Stephen King. I'm planning on reading Beloved for the first time this spring. Otherwise, I don't have much planned for 2024. I'll read at whim as usual.

[+] Dice rolls
